main event: On July 18, 1954, a cigar-shaped object was observed in St. Louis, Illinois for a duration of 3 to 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be flying at an altitude of 30,000 feet,The direction of the object's motion was southerly,The sighting was classified as a probable aircraft sighting,The observer noted encountering scattered clouds at varying altitudes during the sighting,The report mentioned that the object disappeared to the northwest approximately 15 minutes later.
witness description: The observer was likely affiliated with the military and reported various atmospheric conditions during the sighting.
